page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT,DRAYTON AREA
page.content: This area is traditionally a rural farming community,but has recently seen a great change in the distribution of population and in the types of jobs of members of the community, the main employers now being the{service industries.}Many people are employed by the large local {building firm,}Carters, as well as the{Norwich Union Insurance company.}A reasonable number are self-employed, a few work at the local hospitals,whilst nearby{Norwich airport}provides some employment as well as access to {off-shore oil and gas rigs.}Locally- employed skilled workers include carpenters, printers and{shoe-makers, the latter having a long association with the Norwich area.The area has not suffered much from{unemployment}which reflects the{prosperity}of Norfolk and Drayton's {middle-class}structure.
